nealrichardson commented on pull request #6429: ARROW-7862: [R] Linux installation should run quieter by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6429#discussion_r380438568
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -1639,9 +1642,12 @@ macro(build_rapidjson)
   message(STATUS "Building rapidjson from source")
   set(RAPIDJSON_PREFIX
       "${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/rapidjson_ep/src/rapidjson_ep-install")
-  set(RAPIDJSON_CMAKE_ARGS -DRAPIDJSON_BUILD_DOC=OFF -DRAPIDJSON_BUILD_EXAMPLES=OFF
-                           -DRAPIDJSON_BUILD_TESTS=OFF
-                           "-DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=${RAPIDJSON_PREFIX}")
+  set(RAPIDJSON_CMAKE_ARGS
+      ${EP_COMMON_CMAKE_ARGS}
 
 Review comment:
   I suspect RapidJSON isn't the only ep that wasn't getting EP_COMMON_CMAKE_ARGS passed to it but I didn't do a thorough audit as it was the only one that was causing my issue.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #6429: ARROW-7862: [R] Linux installation should run quieter by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6429#discussion_r380583118
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/r_test.sh
 ##########
 @@ -24,16 +24,27 @@ source_dir=${1}/r
 
 pushd ${source_dir}
 
-export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${ARROW_HOME}/lib:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
-export R_LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
-export ARROW_R_CXXFLAGS='-Werror'
+if [ "$ARROW_USE_PKG_CONFIG" != "FALSE" ]; then
+  export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${ARROW_HOME}/lib:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
+  export R_LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
+fi
+if [ "$ARROW_R_CXXFLAGS" != "" ]; then
+  export _R_CHECK_COMPILATION_FLAGS_=FALSE
+fi
 export TEST_R_WITH_ARROW=TRUE
 export _R_CHECK_TESTS_NLINES_=0
 export _R_CHECK_CRAN_INCOMING_REMOTE_=FALSE
 export _R_CHECK_LIMIT_CORES_=FALSE
-export _R_CHECK_COMPILATION_FLAGS_=FALSE
 export VERSION=$(grep ^Version DESCRIPTION | sed s/Version:\ //)
 
+# Make sure we aren't writing to the home dir (CRAN _hates_ this but there is no official check)
+BEFORE=$(ls -alh ~/)
+
 ${R_BIN} -e "rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck(build_args = '--no-build-vignettes', args = c('--no-manual', '--as-cran', '--ignore-vignettes', '--run-donttest'), error_on = 'warning', check_dir = 'check')"
 
+AFTER=$(ls -alh ~/)
+if [ "$BEFORE" != "$AFTER" ]; then
 
 Review comment:
   This will fail if `CMAKE_EXPORT_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY` isn't set, right? e.g. if a developer runs docker-compose directly to test some R changes.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on pull request #6429: ARROW-7862: [R] Linux installation should run quieter by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6429#discussion_r380815519
 
 

 ##########
 File path: docker-compose.yml
 ##########
 @@ -732,6 +732,8 @@ services:
     shm_size: *shm-size
     environment:
       <<: *ccache
+      ARROW_R_CXXFLAGS: '-Werror'
+      LIBARROW_BUILD: 'false'
 
 Review comment:
   This disables the part of the R package configure script that would build Arrow C++ libraries if they weren't found. In the `ubuntu-r` job, we build the C++ library outside of the R package installation, so we already have it and should be testing against that build. This is just a failsafe in case for some reason we break the ability to use that C++ library built outside the R package installation, to make sure the build fails hard.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

 Review comment:

nealrichardson commented on pull request #6429: ARROW-7862: [R] Linux installation should run quieter by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6429#discussion_r380812881
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/r_test.sh
 ##########
 @@ -24,16 +24,27 @@ source_dir=${1}/r
 
 pushd ${source_dir}
 
-export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${ARROW_HOME}/lib:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
-export R_LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
-export ARROW_R_CXXFLAGS='-Werror'
+if [ "$ARROW_USE_PKG_CONFIG" != "FALSE" ]; then
+  export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${ARROW_HOME}/lib:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
+  export R_LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
+fi
+if [ "$ARROW_R_CXXFLAGS" != "" ]; then
+  export _R_CHECK_COMPILATION_FLAGS_=FALSE
+fi
 export TEST_R_WITH_ARROW=TRUE
 export _R_CHECK_TESTS_NLINES_=0
 export _R_CHECK_CRAN_INCOMING_REMOTE_=FALSE
 export _R_CHECK_LIMIT_CORES_=FALSE
-export _R_CHECK_COMPILATION_FLAGS_=FALSE
 export VERSION=$(grep ^Version DESCRIPTION | sed s/Version:\ //)
 
+# Make sure we aren't writing to the home dir (CRAN _hates_ this but there is no official check)
+BEFORE=$(ls -alh ~/)
+
 ${R_BIN} -e "rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck(build_args = '--no-build-vignettes', args = c('--no-manual', '--as-cran', '--ignore-vignettes', '--run-donttest'), error_on = 'warning', check_dir = 'check')"
 
+AFTER=$(ls -alh ~/)
+if [ "$BEFORE" != "$AFTER" ]; then
 
 Review comment:
   There are two scenarios where this script is run:
   
   1. `docker-compose run ubuntu-r`, in which you've already built the C++ library so cmake isn't invoked by `R CMD check`
   2. `docker-compose run r`, which uses the `r/inst/build_arrow_static.sh` script, which calls cmake with `CMAKE_EXPORT_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY` set
   
   Both should be safe for local dev. I confirmed the latter but the former (which you're probably more interested in) logically can't be a problem.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on pull request #6429: ARROW-7862: [R] Linux installation should run quieter by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6429#discussion_r380816743
 
 

 ##########
 File path: docker-compose.yml
 ##########
 @@ -755,17 +757,15 @@ services:
         base: ${R_ORG}/${R_IMAGE}:${R_TAG}
     shm_size: *shm-size
     environment:
-      TEST_R_WITH_ARROW: "true"
       NOT_CRAN: "true"
       LIBARROW_DOWNLOAD: "false"
+      ARROW_HOME: "/arrow"
+      ARROW_USE_PKG_CONFIG: "FALSE"
 
 Review comment:
   This env var is the converse of `LIBARROW_BUILD: false`, as in: ignore any arrow C++ libraries installed on the system and do the bundled build in the R package installation.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on pull request #6429: ARROW-7862: [R] Linux installation should run quieter by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6429#discussion_r380896457
 
 

 ##########
 File path: docker-compose.yml
 ##########
 @@ -755,17 +757,15 @@ services:
         base: ${R_ORG}/${R_IMAGE}:${R_TAG}
     shm_size: *shm-size
     environment:
-      TEST_R_WITH_ARROW: "true"
       NOT_CRAN: "true"
       LIBARROW_DOWNLOAD: "false"
+      ARROW_HOME: "/arrow"
+      ARROW_USE_PKG_CONFIG: "FALSE"
 
 Review comment:
   Most of them aren't but I think this one is, seemed like it would be tedious to make it case insensitive in the configure script (while the others are handled in R and wrapped in `tolower()`) but it's probably worth it so as not to get tripped up on it.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: No need to blow up the console by default. Also this solves an {{R CMD check}} warning that surfaced on CRAN.
fields.summary: [R] Linux installation should run quieter by default
